In this session we will be discussing from the 22nd and the 23rd verses of the 12th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
The 22nd verse.
The 2nd verse is as follows.
Mrigendra Iva Vikranto Nishavyo Himavaniva Titikshur Vasudeva Asau Sahishnuhu Pitarav Iva
The meaning of this verse is
This child will be as strong as a lion and as worthy a shelter as the Himalaya mountains.
He will be forbearing like the earth and as tolerant as his parents.
So the...
Wonderful qualities of the child Parikshit are being described by the Brahmanas who are performing the Jatakarma samskara for the child.
Yudhishthira is hearing all this and he is very satisfied that such a qualified child has actually taken birth in his family.
So in the purport Srila Prabhupada explains.
One is compared to the lion when one is very strong in chasing an enemy among the animals in the jungle.
The king of the jungle or the forest is the lion because the lion is very strong in chasing an enemy.
One should be a lamb at home and a lion in the chase.
So this is the moral instruction that however strong one is or powerful one is that strength or power is not shown at home.
At home in front of elders, family members and other well-wishers one should be very mild and humble.
But somebody...
Who is a Kshatriya he should be like a lion in the chase means he should be very strong in chasing the enemy.
And Srila Prabhupada says the lion is never a failure when it comes to chasing an animal.
Similarly the head of the state should never fail in chasing an enemy.
